dublin_core.dcvalue: The use of GSM or D net mobile phones has been proven to disturb antibradycardiac pacemaker function by electromagnetic fields Therefore interference between these phones and subpectroral ICD systems is conceivable We investigated effects on programmed parameters sensing and pacing as well as detection and termination of arrhythmias in 15 patients with pectoral single lead ICD systems Cardiac Pacemaker Inc Ventak PRX III and Ventak Mini During all tests including stand by mode incoming and outgoing calls and transmission no malfunction of the ICDs occurred In conclusion the use of a D net mobile phone European GSM standard by patients with subpectoral ICD systems of the tested types seems to be safe
[Are pectoral implanted cardioverter defibrillators subject to electromagnetic interference by D-net mobile-phones].
